fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/q_c
fcs_function.description: Dynamic pressure. Pound per square feet

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/q_c_Nsqm
fcs_function.description: Newton per square meter

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/P_s
fcs_function.description: Static pressure. Pound per square feet

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/F1
fcs_function.description: Stick limit

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/F2
fcs_function.description: Static stability TP-1538: simplified to 0.5

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/F3
fcs_function.description: Pitch rate gain and pitch loop gain schedule.

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/F3-loop-alt
fcs_function.description:
TP-1538: pitch loop gain schedule.
Not used

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/F3-rate-alt
fcs_function.description:
TP-1538: Pitch rate gain schedule.
Not used

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/ari/F7
fcs_function.description: Turn coordination TP-1538 is almost same.

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/yaw/F8
fcs_function.description: Yaw axis TP-1538 is simplified to 0.5

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/tef/F9
fcs_function.description: Transonic flaps

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/roll/F10
fcs_function.description: Roll horiz tail TP-1538 is simplified to 0.25

fcs_function.name: accelerations/a_n
fcs_function.description:
Page 43: Calc of G-force.
I had some trouble using the Nz, but don't remember what it was.

fcs_function.name: accelerations/a_y
fcs_function.description:
Page 43: Calc of lateral G-force.
I had some trouble using the Ny. Its feedback made rudder oscillate at very high speeds.

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/roll/control-c/elevator-cmd-input
fcs_function.description: The -1 factor was removed since it was wrong. When more than 5 deg nosedown elev is commanded this comes into effect.

pure_gain.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/roll/yaw-rate-input
pure_gain.description: Is +8.34 in diagram, but must be negative to really work as flat spin protection. And for slow flat spins it was way too small.

lag_filter.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/roll/flaperon-right-lag
lag_filter.description: Power actuator dynamics rate limit = 80 deg/s

lag_filter.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/roll/flaperon-left-lag
lag_filter.description: Power actuator dynamics rate limit = 80 deg/s

pure_gain.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/ari/final
pure_gain.description:
Here the ARI result is multiplied to aileron demand, the result is how much ARI contributes to rudder.
Notice that in TP-1538 the intergain has not been multiplied by 0.5. But thats fine due to in that document it is a single aileron value used, while here we subtract both aileron values, so its double.

kinematic.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/yaw/rudder-cmd-norm-kinematic
kinematic.description: Real pedals can not be moved as fast as a joystick. This will limit the movement speed.

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/yaw/command-deg
fcs_function.description: The +- 15 includes mech preload and electrical breakout.

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/yaw/command-schedule
fcs_function.description:
In Cat I TP-1538 say 20-30, but modern flight manual say 14-26. Here I have implemented modern values.
TODO: Consider using aero/alpha-deg here instead of a_f. TP-1538 does say it uses alpha indicated directly.

pure_gain.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/yaw/alt-schedule
pure_gain.description: Is +0.75 in diagram. TODO: check the validity

lag_filter.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/yaw/rudder-lag
lag_filter.description: Power actuator dynamics Rate limit = 120 deg/s

switch.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/negative-g-limit-final
switch.description: The second test is for MPO switch enabled. Source: The Israeli document.

switch.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/g-limit-product
switch.description: The second test is for MPO switch enabled. Source: The Israeli document.

pure_gain.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/control-c/da_p
pure_gain.description:
I just named this control-c since it uses the same enable switch, its really control-b.
da_p is factored in 3 places in pitch system. Purpose is to reduce inertia-coupling pitch-out departures when rolling at high angle of attack. its not used in yaw, ari or roll.

switch.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/alpha-indicated-mpo
switch.description:
The test is for MPO switch enabled. Source: The Israeli document.
Since this is part of pitch limiter scheme it uses alpha-sum instead of a_f.

pure_gain.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/ground-input
pure_gain.description: Diagram say 0.5, but negative makes more sense. Negative will limit the integrator action when on ground.

deadband.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/integrator-feedback-deadzone
deadband.description: It deceptionally looks like 23 on diagram. But it +-25 since that the actuatorlimit.

pure_gain.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/alpha-feedback
pure_gain.description: Since this is part of pitch limiter scheme it uses alpha-sum instead of a_f.

summer.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/pitch-rate-gain-sum
summer.description: Since this is part of pitch limiter scheme it uses alpha-sum instead of a_f.

switch.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/pitch-rate-lower-switch
switch.description: Is 1.0 or 10 in diagram, but does not make sense to me.

lag_filter.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/pitch-rate-lower-lag
lag_filter.description: Diagram say 0.125, but that does a pitch up for too long after takeoff

switch.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/normal-1-special
switch.description: This prevents NaN to propagate through the system

second_order_filter.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/pitch-rate-lead-2nd
second_order_filter.description: on old diagram looks to be 2.5, not 2 nor 25

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/pitch/block15-horz-tail-factor
fcs_function.description:
Block-15 and above had the horizontal tail surface enlarged by 25% for better control. This data does not factor that in so do it ourselves.
Basically larger value will make the deep stall worse.

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/throttle/pos-norm
fcs_function.description: Page 153 of secondary doc

fcs_function.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/lef/lef-pos-r-norm
fcs_function.description: Inversed normalized LEF. Used in aero.

pure_gain.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/tef/tef-pos-norm
pure_gain.description: Using integrator output as mechanical bias should not be feed into aerodynamics

pure_gain.name: fcs/fly-by-wire/tef/tef-pos-deg-hud
pure_gain.description: This value should be displayed in HUD.

fcs_function.name: systems/approach-speed
fcs_function.description: Page A7-3 of Supplement HAF manual
